aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for Newport Airport Accident
The accident site had Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was Day.
The observation facility was Newport State Airport (EFK).
Newport State Airport (EFK) has an elevation of 930 feet mean sea level.
The distance from the accident site to the observation facility was 0 Nautical Miles.
The observation time was 16:55 Local.
The direction from the accident site to the observation facility was 0 degrees.
The lowest cloud condition was Scattered clouds at 7500 feet Above Ground Level.
The visibility at the accident site was 10 miles.
No lowest ceiling was reported.
No Runway Visual Range (RVR) visibility was reported.
The wind speed was 7 knots.
No wind gusts were reported.
No turbulence was forecast.
No actual turbulence was reported.
The wind direction was 300 degrees.
No turbulence severity was forecast.
Turbulence severity actual was Not Applicable.
The altimeter setting was 29.95 inches of mercury.
The temperature was 24 degrees Celsius.
The dew point was 10 degrees Celsius.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Newport, Vermont (EFK).
No flight plan was filed.
The destination was Newport, Vermont (EFK).
No clearance was issued.
The type of airspace was Class G.
At 2055, the recorded weather at Newport State Airport (EFK) included wind from 300 degrees at 7 knots.
At 2055, the recorded visibility at Newport State Airport (EFK) was 10 statute miles.
At 2055, Newport State Airport (EFK) had scattered clouds at 7,500 feet.
At 2055, the temperature at Newport State Airport (EFK) was 24 degrees Celsius.
At 2055, the dewpoint at Newport State Airport (EFK) was 10 degrees Celsius.
At 2055, the altimeter setting at Newport State Airport (EFK) was 29.95 inches of mercury.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

## Conditions at Accident Site:
| Condition | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Visual (VMC) | - |
| Condition of Light | Day |
| Observation Facility, Elevation | EFK,930 ft msl |
| Distance from Accident Site | 0 Nautical Miles |
| Observation Time | 16:55 Local |
| Direction from Accident Site | 0 |
| Lowest Cloud Condition | Scattered / 7500 ft AGL |
| Visibility | 10 miles |
| Lowest Ceiling | - |
| Visibility (RVR) | - |
| Wind Speed/Gusts | 7 knots / |
| Turbulence Type Forecast/Actual | / None |
| Wind Direction | 300 |
| Turbulence Severity Forecast/Actual | / N/A |
| Altimeter Setting | 29.95 inches Hg |
| Temperature/Dew Point | 24C / 10C |
| Precipitation and Obscuration | No Obscuration; No Precipitation |
| Departure Point | Newport, VT (EFK ) |
| Type of Flight Plan Filed | None |
| Destination | Newport, VT (EFK ) |
| Type of Clearance | None |
| Departure Time | Type of Airspace: Class G |

At 2055 the ecorded weather at EFK included, wind 300 degrees at 7 knots, visibility 10 statute miles, scattered clouds at 7,500 feet, temperature 24 C, dewpoint 10 C, and altimeter setting of 29.95 inches of mercury.
